author: Tom Brew
title: Officials say a single-engine plane has crashed off the coast of Atlantic City, NJ - @NBCPhiladelphia
text: Plane Crashes Off Coast of Atlantic City Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=326507931&videoID=e2eD2brOl2nS&origin=nbcphiladelphia.com&sec=news&subsec=local&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » A small plane from Michigan crashed into the ocean 17 miles off the coast of Atlantic City. NBC10's Ted Greenberg has the details. (Published Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015) Updated 2 hours ago The U.S. Coast Guard confirmed that a plane with one man onboard went down into the ocean off the coast of Atlantic City Thursday afternoon. Officials with the FAA said the single-engine Mooney M20 aircraft reportedly crashed into the Atlantic Ocean about 2:45 Thursday. New Jersey state police said the plane went down about 7 miles off the coast. Debris was discovered by a police marine unit around 3:30. The plane was on its way to Atlantic City from Michigan according to the FAA. Coast Guard Confirms Plane Crash off AC Coast A small plane went down and debris has been found in the water near Atlantic City, New Jersey. NBC10's Ted Greenberg has more details. (Published Thursday, Sept. 10, 2015) Divers continued to search for the man Thursday evening. Published 5 hours ago
